answers.answer:
Our contracts are fully open-source (MIT and can be found on our GitHub repos or on block explorers.

Commit protocol encourages developers to build on top of it or enhance it, contributing to programmable accontability of both onchain and offchain actions across the ecosystem.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
Commit protocol combines credible commitments with financial and social incentives. 

Users can create a 'commit' (commitment/challenge) with a stake amount, deadlines, and optional extra rewards. Those who achieve their goals get their stake back, plus a share of the losers' stakes and any additional 'extra rewards' (erc20 tokens; soon more).

We believe we need more meaningful apps solving real problems — not just speculation-driven ones. Commit offers a simple yet powerful primitive, and we believe it has the potential to become a viral social app beyond ‘just’ crypto-natives. Millions of people love challenges and make commitments daily, often without realizing how central they are to life. 

Combining onchain accountability (credible commitments) with social and financial incentives could unlock new use cases and social behavior — from small (private friend groups / onchain communities) to large coordination mechanisms (large-scale DAOs / orgs).

// latest demo: https://x.com/revrfg/status/1884426456572322231
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer: We’re planning to improve the existing core flow of commits, onboarding UX, adding more social mechanisms (social sharing, inviting friends, activity feed, and more), and make important protocol-wide updates (such as milestone-based commits ft. customisable updates — daily, weekly, etc)
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Commit
project.description:
Commit is the onchain accountability protocol that aims to make people accountable by adding crypto stakes. If someone doesn't deliver, their stake is shared among those who do.

Potential use cases:
1. Personal Goals: motivate yourself or friends to reach fitness goals, write every day, build other good habits, or whatever!
2. Events: Attendees stake crypto to get tickets. Show up, get it back. No-show, others get your stake.
… and more!

We’re fully bootstrapped and iterating — your support would mean a lot. Thank you!
